item.text: The Lord’s message came to me:

“<st data-num="01121" class="">Son</st> of <st data-num="0120" class="">man</st>, of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="06086" class="">woody</st> <st data-num="02156 0834 01961">branches</st> among the <st data-num="06086" class="">trees</st> of the <st data-num="03293" class="">forest</st>, <st data-num="04100" class="">what</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">happens to</st> the <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> of the <st data-num="01612" class="">vine</st>?<n id="1" />

Can <st data-num="06086" class="">wood</st> be <st data-num="03947" class="">taken</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it to <st data-num="06213" class="">make</st> <st data-num="04399" class="">anything useful</st>? <st data-num="0518" class="">Or</st> can anyone <st data-num="03947" class="">make</st> a <st data-num="03489" class="">peg</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it to <st data-num="08518" class="">hang</st> <st data-num="03605 03627">things</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st>?

<st data-num="02009" class="">No</st>!<n id="1" /> It is <st data-num="05414" class="">thrown</st> in the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> for <st data-num="0402" class="">fuel</st>; when the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> has <st data-num="0398" class="">burned up</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">both</st> <st data-num="07098" class="">ends</st> of it and it is <st data-num="02787" class="">charred</st> in the <st data-num="08432" class="">middle</st>, will it <st data-num="06743" class="">be useful</st> for <st data-num="04399" class="">anything</st>?
Indeed! If it was not made into anything useful when it was whole, how much less can it be made into anything when the fire has burned it up and it is charred?

“Therefore, this is what the Sovereign Lord says: Like the wood of the vine is among the trees of the forest that I have provided as fuel for the fire—so I will provide the residents of Jerusalem as fuel.
I will set my face against them—although they have escaped from the fire, the fire will still consume them! Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I set my face against them.
I will make the land desolate because they have acted unfaithfully, declares the Sovereign Lord.”
